TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr K. - PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant was a citizen of GPE ( “ GPE ” ) and is an engineer by profession . He inter alia contributed to the optional supplementary pension system and an additional pension scheme open to engineers ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) .

On DATE ORG for Salaried Employees ( GPE für DATE hereinafter referred to as “ ORG ” ) provided the applicant with information as to his contribution periods and the basis for the calculation of his pension ( NORP und PERSON ) .

On DATE he lodged an objection . On DATE ORG issued a new decision taking into account additional contribution periods , thereby partially quashing the initial decision . The applicant then supplemented his pending objection , which was finally rejected on DATE .

Subsequently , he brought an action in ORG contesting that his contributions to the GPE optional supplementary pension scheme were only taken into account up to the social security contribution ceiling for GPE ( ORG ) according to the provisions of ORG . CARDINAL . However , the applicant did not contest the determination of his contribution periods .
On DATE ORG rejected his action .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal holding that the application of the social security contribution ceiling could only be the subject of proceedings dealing with the actual amount of pension whereas the present proceedings only concerned the establishment of the periods during which contributions had been made . The court refused the applicant leave to appeal on points of law .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint .
On DATE ORG refused to admit the applicant ’s complaint .

On DATE ORG determined the amount of the applicant ’s pension . On DATE the applicant retired . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s objection . He then brought an action in ORG and the proceedings appear to be still pending .

In the GPE there were a compulsory general pension scheme ( GPE ) , an optional supplementary pension scheme ( PERSON ) and furthermore additional pension schemes for certain professions or groups ( Zusatz- PERSON ) , which led to a considerable increase of the amount of pension .

For a more detailed overview of the GPE pension system , its transfer to GPE ( “ FRG ” ) and the calculation of pensions see the ORG ’s recent decision in the case of PERSON and Others ( see PERSON and Others v. GPE ( dec . ) , no . PERSON , DATE ) .

“ ( CARDINAL ) Where no decision has been rendered regarding an application for the performance of an administrative act within a reasonable time and without sufficient grounds , an action in court shall be admissible DATE after an application for the performance of the administrative act has been submitted . ( ... )
( CARDINAL ) The same applies if no decision upon an objection was rendered providing that a DATE time - limit shall apply as a reasonable time limit . ”
